alert.note: Alert for Finney; Hamilton; Hodgeman; Kearny; Pawnee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Watch issued January 12 at 1:56PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Dodge City
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ SUNDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Hamilton, Kearny and Finney Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 9 AM CST /8 AM MST/ this morning. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ this evening to 6 PM CST /5 PM MST/ Sunday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Sunday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is not typical January cold. This is some of the coldest arctic air southwest Kansas has seen in years. Becoming stranded outdoors without the necessary protection from the cold will be life threatening. Remember to protect pets and livestock...they feel wind chill too!
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
